trans-unit.source: Purpose of the Windows PowerShell ISE Scripting Object Model
trans-unit.target: Purpose of the Windows PowerShell ISE Scripting Object Model

trans-unit.source: powershell,cmdlet
trans-unit.target: powershell,cmdlet

trans-unit.source: Purpose of the Windows PowerShell ISE Scripting Object Model
trans-unit.target: Purpose of the Windows PowerShell ISE Scripting Object Model

trans-unit.source: Objects are associated with the form and function of Windows PowerShell Integrated Scripting Environment (ISE).
trans-unit.target: Objects are associated with the form and function of Windows PowerShell Integrated Scripting Environment (ISE).

trans-unit.source: The object model reference provides details about the member properties and methods that these objects expose.
trans-unit.target: The object model reference provides details about the member properties and methods that these objects expose.

trans-unit.source: Examples are provided to show how you can use scripts to directly access these methods and properties.
trans-unit.target: Examples are provided to show how you can use scripts to directly access these methods and properties.

trans-unit.source: The scripting object model makes the following range of tasks easier.
trans-unit.target: The scripting object model makes the following range of tasks easier.

trans-unit.source: Customizing the appearance of Windows PowerShell ISE
trans-unit.target: Customizing the appearance of Windows PowerShell ISE

trans-unit.source: You can use the object model to modify the application settings and options.
trans-unit.target: You can use the object model to modify the application settings and options.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can modify them as follows:
trans-unit.target: For example, you can modify them as follows:

trans-unit.source: You can change the color of errors, warnings, verbose outputs, and debug outputs.
trans-unit.target: You can change the color of errors, warnings, verbose outputs, and debug outputs.

trans-unit.source: You can get or set the background colors for the Command pane, the Output pane, and the Script pane.
trans-unit.target: You can get or set the background colors for the Command pane, the Output pane, and the Script pane.

trans-unit.source: You can set the foreground color for the Output pane.
trans-unit.target: You can set the foreground color for the Output pane.

trans-unit.source: You can set the font name and font size for Windows PowerShell ISE.
trans-unit.target: You can set the font name and font size for Windows PowerShell ISE.

trans-unit.source: You can configure warnings.
trans-unit.target: You can configure warnings.

trans-unit.source: This setting includes warnings that are issued when a file is opened in multiple PowerShell tabs or when a script in the file is run before the file has been saved.
trans-unit.target: This setting includes warnings that are issued when a file is opened in multiple PowerShell tabs or when a script in the file is run before the file has been saved.

trans-unit.source: You can switch between a view where the Script pane and the Output pane are side-by-side and a view where the Script pane is on top of the Output pane.
trans-unit.target: You can switch between a view where the Script pane and the Output pane are side-by-side and a view where the Script pane is on top of the Output pane.

trans-unit.source: You can dock the Command pane to the bottom or the top of the Output pane.
trans-unit.target: You can dock the Command pane to the bottom or the top of the Output pane.

trans-unit.source: Enhancing the functionality of Windows PowerShell ISE
trans-unit.target: Enhancing the functionality of Windows PowerShell ISE

trans-unit.source: You can use the object model to enhance the functionality of Windows PowerShell ISE.
trans-unit.target: You can use the object model to enhance the functionality of Windows PowerShell ISE.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can:
trans-unit.target: For example, you can:

trans-unit.source: Add and modify the instance of Windows PowerShell ISE itself.
trans-unit.target: Add and modify the instance of Windows PowerShell ISE itself.

trans-unit.source: For example, to change the menus, you can add new menu items and map the new menu items to scripts.
trans-unit.target: For example, to change the menus, you can add new menu items and map the new menu items to scripts.

trans-unit.source: Create scripts that perform some of the tasks that you can perform by using the menu commands and buttons in Windows PowerShell ISE.
trans-unit.target: Create scripts that perform some of the tasks that you can perform by using the menu commands and buttons in Windows PowerShell ISE.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can add, remove, or select a PowerShell tab.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can add, remove, or select a PowerShell tab.

trans-unit.source: Complement tasks that can be performed by using menu commands and buttons.
trans-unit.target: Complement tasks that can be performed by using menu commands and buttons.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can rename a PowerShell tab.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can rename a PowerShell tab.

trans-unit.source: Manipulate text buffers for the Command pane, the Output pane, and the Script pane that are associated with a file.
trans-unit.target: Manipulate text buffers for the Command pane, the Output pane, and the Script pane that are associated with a file.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can:
trans-unit.target: For example, you can:

trans-unit.source: Get or set all text.
trans-unit.target: Get or set all text.

trans-unit.source: Get or set a text selection.
trans-unit.target: Get or set a text selection.

trans-unit.source: Run a script or run a selected portion of a script.
trans-unit.target: Run a script or run a selected portion of a script.

trans-unit.source: Scroll a line into view.
trans-unit.target: Scroll a line into view.

trans-unit.source: Insert text at a caret position.
trans-unit.target: Insert text at a caret position.

trans-unit.source: Select a block of text.
trans-unit.target: Select a block of text.

trans-unit.source: Get the last line number.
trans-unit.target: Get the last line number.

trans-unit.source: Perform file operations.
trans-unit.target: Perform file operations.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can:
trans-unit.target: For example, you can:

trans-unit.source: Open a file, save a file, or save a file by using a different name.
trans-unit.target: Open a file, save a file, or save a file by using a different name.

trans-unit.source: Determine whether a file has been changed after it was last saved.
trans-unit.target: Determine whether a file has been changed after it was last saved.

trans-unit.source: Get the file name.
trans-unit.target: Get the file name.

trans-unit.source: Select a file.
trans-unit.target: Select a file.

trans-unit.source: Automating tasks
trans-unit.target: Automating tasks

trans-unit.source: You can use the scripting object model to create keyboard shortcuts for frequent operations.
trans-unit.target: You can use the scripting object model to create keyboard shortcuts for frequent operations.

trans-unit.source: See Also
trans-unit.target: See Also
